title.narrative: Strategic Sector Cooperation in Education between DK and Vietnam, Phase II

description.narrative: The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Education aims to contribute to framework conditions that strengthen the relevance, quality, and responsiveness of vocational education in Vietnam by: - Supporting a more agile and responsive technical vocational education and training system in Vietnam - Improving education quality; - Improving student recruitment and improved enterprise approval rate of the graduates - Improving knowledge sharing and dissemination between technical vocational education and training colleges and their lecturers.

The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Education is a peer-to-peer cooperation between the Danish Ministry of Education and the Vietnamese Ministry of Labour, Invalids and Social Affairs. Through the project, the Vietnamese ministry will strengthen the relevance, quality, and responsiveness of vocational education in Vietnam.
A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon.
Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.
